item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:39, topic:518402”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=636666.msg4303191#msg4303191 date=1369338361]

Out of curiosity, why do people still play CoD? I haven’t touched any CoD game for a long time because it’s just not fun anymore.

You answered your own question. You haven’t played Call of Duty because it’s not fun for you anymore. If they buy it, it means they have fun playing it.
[/quote]
Wrong

I bought mw2, black ops, and black ops 2 each time thinking it would be better than the last yet I ultimately ended up very disappointed and the game had gone in a completely different direction compared to COD4 and WaW[/quote]Watch the behind the scenes on xbox…

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:35, topic:518402”][quote author=xI c E link=topic=636666.msg4303171#msg4303171 date=1369334849]
Out of curiosity, why do people still play CoD? I haven’t touched any CoD game for a long time because it’s just not fun anymore.
[/quote]
You answered your own question. You haven’t played Call of Duty because it’s not fun for you anymore. If they buy it, it means they have fun playing it.[/quote]
Wrong

I bought mw2, black ops, and black ops 2 each time thinking it would be better than the last yet I ultimately ended up very disappointed and the game had gone in a completely different direction compared to COD4 and WaW

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“xI c E, post:37, topic:518402”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=636666.msg4303219#msg4303219 date=1369340713]

Out of curiosity, why do people still play CoD? I haven’t touched any CoD game for a long time because it’s just not fun anymore.
[/quote][quote author=xI c E link=topic=636666.msg4303171#msg4303171 date=1369334849]
Out of curiosity, why do people still play CoD? I haven’t touched any CoD game for a long time because it’s just not fun anymore.

I doubt it’s out of curiosity, it’s just you attempting to say you think the games bad but making yourself seem like an idiot in the process.
[/quote]

Do you just always just assume everything? If I thought it was bad then I would just say it’s bad, don’t play it.[/quote]
Not fun = bad because games exist for pleasure? Games are meant to be fun. I do assume things a lot though, considering a post doesn’t tell you enough information a lot of the time & it’s not like a real conversation so I can’t ask without waiting a couple minute (or longer) pause; it’d be stupid not to assume although I am still right and you are still an idiot.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I don’t like the look of some of the features ingame like the whole tilting sliding thing, environment noises being super loud (I like how cod isn’t realistic…) and so on. Otherwise it looks like a new mw3 so I’ll probably really like it. I won’t like it as much as I do mw3 but I’ll play it rather than mw3 probably purely because of the match making cough and new technology should improve some of the glitchy gameplay.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @tehjamdude tehjamdude
item.description:
@tehjamdude wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:27, topic:518402”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=636666.msg4295239#msg4295239 date=1368106166]
I just don’t like CoD in general. It’s too mainstream (way too many little kids playing) and it’s horribly managed, the developers barely care about it after they release it besides throwing out pre-made maps for $20. Another thing that bugs me is having sidebar videos on YouTube with titles like “Quick-scope fakey 360 grannyslam 900 u won’t believe it!!!.” I will agree it is fun, I’ve hopped on MW2 a few times with friends for a few games, but I haven’t bought the last two releases and I don’t plan on buying the next ones. MW3 killed the franchise for me and I don’t ever plan on buying another.

When I play XBOX it’s generally campaign games (Bioshock Infinite is an A+ game) or Battlefield 3. I won’t turn this into a BF VS. CoD topic, but one of the reasons I love BF3 is that DICE actually patches and balances. They have many more mechanics to balance than CoD does anyway, but that’s where I stand.
[/quote]
cod shitted up game wise at bo 1 for me completely and it turned into a daycare at mw2[/quote]

Black Ops 1 Ruined it for me as well. I did buy bo2 and liked it until all the little kids started playing all the time. My heart will always be with Modern Warfare 2 and World at war.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I just don’t like CoD in general. It’s too mainstream (way too many little kids playing) and it’s horribly managed, the developers barely care about it after they release it besides throwing out pre-made maps for $20. Another thing that bugs me is having sidebar videos on YouTube with titles like “Quick-scope fakey 360 grannyslam 900 u won’t believe it!!!.” I will agree it is fun, I’ve hopped on MW2 a few times with friends for a few games, but I haven’t bought the last two releases and I don’t plan on buying the next ones. MW3 killed the franchise for me and I don’t ever plan on buying another.

When I play XBOX it’s generally campaign games (Bioshock Infinite is an A+ game) or Battlefield 3. I won’t turn this into a BF VS. CoD topic, but one of the reasons I love BF3 is that DICE actually patches and balances. They have many more mechanics to balance than CoD does anyway, but that’s where I stand.

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I used to love playing Call of Duty so much, but I don’t know what made me stop playing it. You can’t really say boredom is caused by many similarities and few differences in the series, because this can be seen in just about every single game series.

Read full topic

tehjamdude:

Activision is working on this one, i don’t think Infinity Ward is.

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

His ‘theory’ as you called it has nothing to do with you whatsoever. He didn’t say a single word about you in that sentence.

Anyway, the reason people complain about CoD is that people are literally bullied for not playing such games (happened to me many times; I don’t mean beaten up, but definitely victimized). Making fun of the game, as one would, is simply the logical retaliation.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“tehjamdude, post:18, topic:518402”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=636666.msg4292421#msg4292421 date=1367560192]

ghost coming back!!?!?

From what I know it’s about Ghost’s life, before he died. Or it might not even be Ghost, could be his son or something like that. Though everyone wants Ghost to some how survive being shot then lit on fire I just don’t think that will be the road Infinity Ward will take, no matter how much we want them to.
[/quote]

Activision is working on this one, i don’t think Infinity Ward is.[/quote]
Activision doesn’t develop the games, they just publish them. Also read the bottom of the case here, says Infinity Ward.

[quote=“Chassy13, post:19, topic:518402”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=636666.msg4292358#msg4292358 date=1367546908]
Why people still babble and whine about people who buy this game is beyond me, it’s been 3 years since the babbling started? Why, just why not, get the love over the fact that people want to use their money for something that you may not, if you don’t like Call of Duty then I will respect that but I would expect vice verse, not some text war mongler preaching to everyone why not to buy the best selling game every year, keyword “best selling.”
[/quote]

Your last three words make you sound very hypocritical. It’s only best selling because of the millions of prepubescent kids that don’t know what else to play that would make them kool at skool.[/quote]
Well actually myself, I tend to not let anyone at school play Call of Duty with me. No clue where you’re heading with that theory.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Just like every other new game comes out, I’ll wait until a friend has it and try it there. If I like it, maybe I’ll buy it. The issue I have is that they charge me $65 for it and then another $20 bucks for each map pack which is moronic and one reason I stopped supporting those types of games.

Anyways, yeah, I’ll try it but I probably won’t buy it.

Read full topic
